item.title: Nididdhyasanam
item.description:
• As long as this “how” is with you, you’ll not understand what is meditation. It is not a process, not a technique, not a method. You’ve to drop the question “how to meditate?” and ask “what is meditation?”.
  • Going to a dark room, isolating from the world around you, family, daily life. And you self-enclose yourself in a movement of the mind determined by the (dvaita) school of meditation you attend.
  • Not knowing. Understanding. For that you need spiritual energy. That’s the real kundalini.
  • Images. No that is not meditation. Image is in the present. Vision is in the future. Neither. Those who are striving for a vision they will get a vision.
  • Are you seeking happiness through the medium of meditation?
  • As a person you’ll never be happy and when you’re happy you’ll never be a person.
  • Meditation is the movement of love.
  • Love. Is it the love of the one or of the many? Neither, it is just love. Imagine a flower that spreads fragrance. It is not for one nor for many.
  • Meditation is gut constant awareness. On the surface there are base emotions. Be aware of all of that. Slowly penetrate. And you’ll reach a peace where you’re not there. You’re not a person, you’re not an ego. That peace, that beauty, that silence, that is meditation.

item.title: Karma Yoga
item.description:
source

  • When Gita was started, there was dharma, not religions.
  • In the context of a dharmic civilization worship of Ishvara is called karma.
  • 500 CE something like religious ID started. Before there Christ’s teaching were there.
  • Action is different than work. All natures works. Only humans act. Action is work performed by a human being with a motive.
  • Vivekananda. Humans are slaves. They don’t work like masters. They are slaves to the motives behind their acts. Suppose you erase the motive you’ll not be bound. This is what Shri Krishna was teaching. This is what will give you enthusiasm and courage! No motive and there is no sense of doership nor enjoyership.
  • Breathing - work. Pranayama - action (maybe to reduce high heartbeat).
  • One has to work anyway. But you induce motive (desire) into the work.
  • Origin of action is thought. Lay emphasis not on the outer (the benefits you’ll get), but on the thought. That makes you antarmuhka, otherwise youll remain bahirmukha.
  • Organised religion fails us because it doesn’t allow us to place emphasis on the inner. It pulls you out of yourself and makes you put emphasis on the outer.
  • Another name for motive is desire for the action.
  • Action - result - desire for the result - actor (doer). All of that is one movement. Unitary movement. Motivated thought becomes the origin of the action and creates the actor. The me (ego) which is also a thought.
  • Basic necessities of life are not motives.
  • In the language of Gita the motiveless thought is called pure. The very desire is impure. Impurities of the mind begin with “kama”.
  • Bondage doesn’t depend on being brahmachari, sanjasi, grhasta. Bondage depends on being slave to one’s own imagination.
  • Desire to achieve an end brings about the will, which is the actor. Which is a process of becoming.
  • Narendra Modi: the more you throw mud of me the better the lotus blooms.
  • Our daily life the way we know it is a process of becoming.
  • Focus on the being, not on the becoming. All you want is in the being. Becoming is a strive, pain, constant battle.
  • Horizontal vs. vertical movement.
  • Be totally devoted to the job/duty. Until the last breath. Don’t even think of motive, result, end. This is the devotion. It becomes the offering to the supreme god.
  • The one who created the body/mind will take care of it.
  • Ambition is a poisonous bread. Ambitious person lives for himself.
  • Human mind has a weakness wanting a yes/no answer. One of such question is about ignorance.
  • Darkness is. You switch on the light. It is not. Where is is?
  • In life there are no conclusions, there is only negation. There are no answers. There is only inquiry and it is timeless.

item.title: Bhagavad Gita Chapter 6
item.description:
Class 1

  • The self is as it is not as it is imagined. The self remains veiled by the vasanas. And it reveals itself when there are no vasanas. That is called self-realization that leads to moksha.
  • Desirelessness is godliness.
  • A brashtah is one who doesn’t stay on the course. The loss is not total. Whatever ground you’ve gained, you’ll not lose it. All worldly accomplishments (wealth, power, knowledge) will be lost. None of it transfers to the next birth.
  • Yogabrastah - one who pursues desires and yoga together. He’ll go to heaven.
  • For a sincere seeker going to heaven would be a punishment. Same for a birth to a rich family. So a sincere seeker takes birth in a family of a seekers of truth. Not very well to do people. He’ll have the enormous advantage of satsang without doing any effort. He won’t have the enormous obstacles of heaven and riches.
  • Gita praises birth in a poor family.
  • Intelligence - the critical thinking, love for truth (yoga - self-knowledge), is sva. That is called here buddhi. That you’ll never lose and that transfers to the other life. Everything else is para (the other): wealth, accomplishments … all you’ll lose with death of the body.
  • For truth, you need intelligence, not intellect. Intelligence is the capacity to think freely. Without fear, without a formula.
  • Any form of ambition is worldly. It breads anxiety and fear. Ambition, greed do not help to bring about a mind that is clear, direct, simple and intelligent.
  • In one part of life the reading books, intellect, knowledge is required. In another part of life where you pursue the truth all of that is not going to help.
  • When you prepare a formula, or formulate the pursuit of self-knowledge, it takes you towards knowledge, but not intelligence. Intelligence is very subtle, knowledge very gross.
  • Wisdom, self-knowledge comes into its own, when you understand the total process of your mind. That is intelligence. How it is creating jealousy, greed etc. That doesn’t come from studying books. To get that wisdom, you need not study a single book.
  • Your mind is the result of entire community, family, sometimes entire country.
  • Intelligence arises when there is no fear. If you’re afraid of God, devil who will punish. If you’re afraid of losing money, near and dear. When all that fear is ruling your life, you cannot become intelligent.
  • The movement of fear is the movement of selfishness. Love is the movement of selflessness.
  • There is no brastha in yoga.

Class 2

  • Wealth is a punishment, it prevents intelligence.
  • When the mind becomes quiet, the intelligence comes to the fore.
  • What is the purpose of study? Am I embellishing the braincells or am I enriching my intelligence?
  • In work intelligence means karma yoga. In quarrel there is intelligence - you bless the adversary, understand that it is all very temporal and unreal.
  • When you’re able to love all - that is beauty. There is intelligence in beauty.
  • There is no truth in beliefs. There is intelligence in every aspect of life.
  • Instead of pursuing the truth the people pursue a system.
  • Brain is as mechanical as a machine. What you call knowledge is mechanical and accumulated - data. Whether it is in a GPS or in in the braincell (intellect).
  • If you bring these vasanas to Vedanta it fails to deliver. Vedanta is not so much intellect as intelligence.
  • What is the operation of intelligence? An intelligent mind is constantly learning. You learn from a child, plant, animal, donkey… It is an inquiring mind. Intelligence is not something you can acquire (para) and will lose, it is in you (sva). When the mind is quiet, intelligence shines. Intelligence is hibernating in you, you wake it up.
  • Generally in the presence of the mahatma the vasanas are resolved. When you go into the world and pursue worldly companies the vasanas wake up. And once they are active the jnana remains covered up - that’s the game that’s going on.
  • As he pursues the truth, as the intelligence is playing out, he knows his real being, his fullness. He’s not the body, he’s not born in this world, nor he’s going to die in this world. In fact the world springs from his consciousness and when he goes to sleep the world resolves in him. That’s the intelligence.
  • The essence of ignorance - you feel you were born at a certain place, to a set of parents and you’ll die. And this you keep and nobody should disturb that. How do you know? Because you experience? All of that is hear-say. Please meet me when you have first hand information! You live by hearsay and memory.
  • Action and actionless is not hostile to each other. They are together. That is intelligence. Natural thing happens naturally (what needs to be done gets done) yet you remain the actionlessness in yourself.
  • The effort is in prakuruti (body/mind), there is no effort in yourself. This is samsiddhi. That’s the peace, that’s the bliss. A liberated person’s mind moves and still remains at peace.
  • Samsaris who do not see clearly have thousands of questions and they will never be answered clearly. For a jnani no questions are left.
  • Heaven is a place of wealth and pleasures. There you’re not in your control anymore. You become overwhelmed. Therefore the question of pursuing self-knowledge doesn’t arise in heaven.
  • Students of Vedanta performing kamyakarmas is an enormous contradiction.

Class 3

  • Failure in meditation is superior to success in worldly life.
  • brashta = failure.
  • Failure in yoga can only be temporary. There can be no failure in yoga.
  • Yoga is a battle. You have to battle against your own base emotions and thinking. It is an inner battle. Sri Krishna Arjuna judham is an inner battle.
  • Base emotions always talk of me and mine and pandavah (pandu = whiteness), which is symbol for jnanam. Thoughts and emotions emanating from understanding. And there is a battle and it is called yoga.
  • In judging, comparing, contrasting … you’re only exercising your conditioning.
  • The game: you perform the karma and seek the karma phalam. All that the vijnasu (student of atma) puts aside.
  • Seek quality of life, not longevity.
  • Traigunya premi: pursues wealth, pleasure, punyam (through rituals).
  • You’ve a connect to karmas only as long as you’re not dispassionate.

Class 4

  • How do you look at yourself determines the course of life.
  • Yoga: separation idea has ended. Union with the truth, real, god.
  • Yogi is who was clarity and earnestness required for self-knowledge.
  • Those who worship the pointing finger miss the moon.
  • Yoga is the maturity of heart and mind. It does not come just by reading books, but when you start living whatever little you’ve understood.
  • There is no such thing as a compromise in yoga. The very idea of compromise blocks the way to the truth. Compromise shows a lack of earnestness.
  • Mind will always have problems. It is never free of problems. One way. Hathayoga: try to cure the way. Vedanta: dissociate from the mind.
  • Mind is never free problems. Because mind is addicted to problems. Without problems it feels lost, that’s why it wants sudoku, puzzles.
  • We don’t accept life on its terms. We want life on my terms.
  • In the inner journey you’re alone. Don’t try one more person to join you. It is impossible. “Me and my wife meditation do meditation together” - that is not possible. You can do a puja together. More clever people say guru.
  • Guru is not the person. Guru is the vision. Shankara is before me as a person or as a version? We’re always in communion with Shankara.
  • When you dissociate with mind it will change. It will complain less.
  • Yoga: intense and methodical investigation into the movement of the mind. For hathayoga: suppression.
  • Mind has to be relaxed for yoga. Mind has to be free of desires and then it can relax. This freedom doesn’t come from grim determination.
  • Understanding comes when you pay attention. Pay attention to the mind. By understanding the mind you become free from the mind. That is the meditation.
  • If you pay attention to the sun it becomes the gayatri mantra.
  • In paying attention to the pain you get the quality of endurance. As you do it the quality of pain can change. We don’t rush to the doctor or for the pill. That is meditation, yoga.
  • Narcissist, ahamkari wants admiration all the time. Check if you have the quality in you.
  • You become free from you’ve understood.

Class 5

  • One who arrives at yoga (self-knowledge, jnanam) is yogi. Self-knowledge unites you with the whole.
  • Promises made by the religion sound like the promises by the politicians.
  • Dharma, artha, kama cannot solve the problem of samsara. Only yoga, connect with the inner reality can.
  • Understanding is followed by action. That understanding is yoga. You’ve to get that understanding with appropriate effort. The organism (psychology + physiology) must be in very good shape, fit for it:
    • food: simple diet in moderate quantities. Otherwise the organism will be dull and you’ll not get the understanding,
    • regular good sleep,
    • take physical exercise regularly (both in the morning and evening).
  • Then ponder over the sublime teachings of Gita and Upanishads and live those things in daily life. That is how you prepare.
  • Be in constant company of saintly and spiritually-minded people. Who practice that wisdom in their life and can inspire peace and tranquility in you. If that company is not available, remain alone.
  • On daily basis look within and see the well-entrenched ignorance in your consciousness and recognise it as such. Having done that make a daily effort to rise above the body mind and intellect.
  • Carefully avoid the company of people who disturb your peace of mind. Of worldly people.
  • Upanishad is direct and straightforward. Gita is very complex.
  • Be congruent. Unity in thought, speech, deeds. Trikarana shudhi.
  • Be generous. You cannot be harsh, aggressive, insensitive. Be charitable, kind, helpful.
  • Real is universal. Real includes all. Person is separated. And now it has to escape from the shackles of me and mine and merge with the universal self. That we call yoga.
  • Popular religion hallmarks: desires, fears and selfishness. If you’re a very good religious person you’ve these three qualities. Yoga is desirelessness, fearlessness, selflessness.
  • Yogi doesn’t harm even a plant. Harmlessness is the most powerful part of yoga. Ahimsa paramo dharmah. Buddha, Mahavira, Jesus Christ … all mahapurushas talk of ahimsa. Harmlessness is given a name: nissargayoga - natural yoga. Harmlessness: the art of living in peace and harmony.
  • Shiva is pragna (understanding). Parvati is prana. Bringing together wisdom and life.
  • Your mind is the sishya. Life is the guru.

Class 6

  • People convert Vedanta shravanam into a routine.
  • Study is listening to know. Purpose of listening to Vedanta is to undergo the inner transformation. What kind? Ugly looking larva transmutates into a butterfly. Happy, desireless, fearless universal self.
  • The little egoistic self has to be transformed to the supreme self, the brahman. That’s the reason why you’d come to Vedanta class.
  • Ramathirta: give up the evil companion of desire in your heart. What is evil? Entertaining a desire in your mind.
  • Transformation of the nature: I seek nothing. I’m thirsty I need water - that’s not desire. I need Coca-Cola - that’s a desire, that will hurt you.
  • By desiring something limited you’re denying your nature of brahmanhood. You’d not lose heart.
  • Convert the failures into steppingstones. Do not relax your effort to gain that inner transformation.
  • kilbishah is a blemish which amounts to “sin” in Vedanta.
  • As long as you identify with the physical body, you cannot realize your oneness with the absolute. You’ll not able to achieve anything in life (university - intellect, sport, military - suffering, no comfort) what to speak of Vedanta?
  • To grow to the yoga you need to put away the superstitions. Examine your superstitions, if you’re not the body all of them will collapse.
  • ID with time is another sin.
  • Transform consciousness where there is no division of good and evil. Good and evil is not for you. Is Ukraine evil and Russia good? Or is Russia good and Ukraine evil? Go beyond.
  • Rise above time, space and good and evil divisions. That is when you reach the goal of self-realization.
  • There is only one way to realize God: as the inner most self. To arrive there you’ve to extricate the self that is embedded in body, time, space, opposites of pleasure/pain…
  • Then one more kilbishah - fear. Fear is slavery, fear is cowardice. You need courage.
  • You cannot psychologically depend on others for your upliftment.
  • Is cat coming from left or right a bad omen? As long as it doesn’t jump on you it doesn’t matter.
  • Death is God. You’d look in the face of death and smile!
  • Another kilbishah - worldly pomp and show. All the glamour and glory that we pursue is very transient.

item.title: Bhakta & Bhakti
item.description:
playlist

Part 1, 2

  • Teaching from the Gita is more practical as that of Upanishad. Closer to the ordinary life.
  • The body is the chariot. Arjuna is the master of the chariot. You’re Arjuna.
  • Be clean. Be frank. Be like an open book. One who’s like that is Arjuna. No crookedness, no crafty-ness, innocence.
  • The tree is called Arjuna because it soars straight into the sky.
  • If you keep a distance between you and the teaching, you’ll be quoting Gita, not living Gita.
  • There is no outside enemies. You’re (thoughts, qualities of head and heart) your own enemy.
  • Ideation is not knowledge, idea is not the truth.
  • Kama is an attitude of desiring and people are addicted to it. Constantly desiring one thing or the other. It becomes a habit. But it cannot withstand the scorching of examination, knowledge. Similarly krodha, mada (arrogance).
  • In Sanskrit life is called prAna. pra-ana. Movement. Life is that which makes all this movement, functions possible.
  • Love is not of the mind, attachment is. Love, peace, bliss are from a deeper source.
  • Happiness has an opposite. Bliss not.
  • That peace nobody can disturb once you discover it. Nobody can assail it.
  • Imagine somebody tells a good joke. You’re laughing heartily. You as a person will not be there.
  • Love is unknown, but not inaccessible. It is supremely accessible but you cannot know it. And you come to it by discarding the known. Love cannot be discovered by a mind full of the known.
  • When you say to a person “I love you” you don’t love the person. You want to possess, hold the person. When you try to do it, you’ll get jealousy if you believe the person is possessing by somebody else.
  • Also, love is not a sentiment. To be sentimental is the same as being emotional. Emotionalism is but a sensation.
  • If you see somebody dancing (as love of god) suspect the person right away.
  • A sentimental person cannot know what is love because the sentiment will turn it in opposite direction.
  • In bhakti you’re very calm and quiet. And that quietude expresses in the body outside and inside (mind is resolved), so that you abide as the awareful being. Love is the fragrance of that awareful being. That love is called bhaktih.
  • If Lord Krishna would be standing here in front of us you’d consider him escaped from a drama company.
  • Concentrating on form you have to struggle to make it happen. To concentrate on space you need not only give up. It is so easy.
  • Be aware that you’re in embrace of this power.
  • When you retain your persona and want to love that already is the denial of love.
  • Gita bhasya is very tough, brahmasutra the opposite.
  • Samsari: I love the rose. Bhakti: I love the glory of Ishvara that is in the rose. Ravana being a criminal doesn’t prevent Rama from seeing the glory of Ishvara in him. You’d be able to see the glory of Ishvara in everything, thus loving everything because everything is a conduit through which the glory of Ishvara is becoming abundantly clear, recognizable.

Part 3, 4

  • Evidence -> existence -> nama rupa. Works better with nose, ears than with eyes - the progression is too fast. We’re so attached to nama rupa (last step) that we miss the first two.
  • It exists, therefore it is evident. Vasu (asti) deva (bhati). That astibhati is Ishvara, that is called Vasudeva.
  • You cognize nama rupa, but learn to be aware of the presence.
  • You can feel the presence with closed eyes (touch) more easily.
  • Water’s specific gravity is 1, body 1.9. If only people remain calm, they will not sink.
  • Bhakti: feeling and recognising the presence of Ishvara in all of the things. Deva (Vasudeva) is the feeling.
  • Be always conscious of the blissful and real aspect of the five elements.
  • Water is also called sa:jivanam. It is life.
  • While you’re inhaling, there is bliss. When you’re exhaling, there is a small anxiety. By inhaling you can feel the power of life, by exhaling the power of death.
  • Space represents the power of gravity.
  • Why can’t you accept a tree, piece of stone, river, cow, dog, kid, any human … as divinity?
  • Learn to give up the nama rupa.
  • Mental form - criminal. Physical form - human.
  • You have to rise above the forms, the words, the syllables to get the meaning. Similarly you’ve to rise above the forms of idols etc. to get the divinity.
  • Divine vision: you visualize Isvhara everywhere and Ishavara only and none other that Ishavara. You’ll be able to enjoy the divine bliss anywhere and at any time. The whole world becomes the temple of god. Whatever you do becomes worship. That’s ananyabhakti.
  • Vishvarupa: any head on the earth is Isvhara’s head. That’s why he’s infinite. Every life form is his manifestation. That’s why no himsa. It is more then ethics and morals. It is the divine vision that stops you from hurting another life form.

Class 5, 6

  • Believers will be always insecure unless they have some other believers around. That’s why they seek to convert people. They see security in numbers.
  • One iota of experience is superior to a ton of precept.
  • Pick one idea and live it. A living idea is superior to a ton of precept.
  • SakshatkAra: I’m because I’m, not because I see, not because I think.
  • In the thinking of a devotee god is always compassionate. Because the devotee needs compassion.
  • Common aim of the upasana is to abolish the diversity of names of form.
  • To discover brahman in the worldly objects and also in yourself. So we don’t look at phrtivi as a means of sense gratification.
  • If you love, there is no one that loves apart from the feeling of love. If the person is there that is cupidity.
  • Desirelessness doesn’t belong. Desire belongs (to the small self). As it (desire/fear) springs up it brings above the person.
  • Even after thinking for 10 minutes I don’t find something to desire. Be like that!
  • There is no fear means there is no person. It means you’re merged into divine vision.
  • Wanting a heaven in future means you’re currently living in the hell. Looking for it will convert the present to hell. Heaven in future = credit in future religion. We want cash religion = bliss now and here.
  • I’m not talking. Talking happens. Mahatmas talk. You’ve got a problem with the vision? Go and complain to Sri Krishna or Shankara.
  • If you have 10 rupees you can give 1/2 to a person and the other to somebody else. You can give the same amount of love to one person and to the other. It is infinite, it is like space. It is a fragrance of the being. The appreciation for the chaitanyam/life everywhere.

item.title: Drig Drishya Viveka
item.description:
Satsang 2022-09-02

  • the same vision, depth, as an Upanishad.
  • If you have already studied Vedanta it’s difficult to have an open mind. What can I teach you? You already know.
  • Listen without judging, with open mind, that’s meditation. It’s up to you to take all this to the level of meditation.
  • If you live a life of karma yoga you’re already a liberated soul.
  • You see the snake instead of a garment because you’re insecure.
  • Generally for Vedanta classes vijnasus (student of Vedanta) don’t come. Parents come.
  • Parents should intervene with difficulties of the students only when the situation becomes very abnormal. Let them face the music!
  • I’m - sat - existence. I know - chit. You always know, whether there is something to know or not.
  • You do not quiten the mind (you, you … that’s hathayoga). If you try it will revolt. Allow it to become quiet (that’s vedanta). It can, if you allow it. Quieting the mind will put you in an everlasting conflict. If the mind wants to come with a never lasting train of thought - let it. You’d be able to say “I do not mind when the mind is thinking”.
  • Sharanagatih - self-surrender, not only surrender. Surrender of the small-self. It’s something to be understood, not something to be done.
  • In life, whenever you’re acting, you’ve to ask if the actions are motivated. That’s the opposite of sharanagatih. When you act purposefully, your action is very meaningful, but you do not have any (self-ish) motive behind the action. It means you’re not trying to control, to accomplish anything, because everything is controlled and commanded by the prime mover (antaryAmi - abiding in everything, commanding and controlling). You just do what is expected of you. This is understanding god, this is difficult. Believing is simple.
  • Whatever you record in your mind is impressed there for so long that it is very difficult to wipe it out and begin again. And therefore we never catch anything fresh. That’s why having an open mind is very difficult. Without putting existing aside you learn nothing fresh, you’ll be recycling only. That’s not understanding. Knowledge is the old tape - memory. Understanding is in the present moment. Knowledge accumulates in the braincells, understanding shines in the heart and liberates. Can we put aside the old way of thinking (bible: the old person)?
  • Become free from the old. You can do that by only one way. Paying attention.

Class 1

  • In Sanskrit seeing and knowing are taken as the same. Seer (drg) means knower. Seeing is more than knowing, it carries a punch in it which knowing doesn’t have. “Do you know Vaikuntha?” Like that.
  • Objects, need not be physical, are all part of the seen (drshya). The seen is more than just physical, all your ideas that you have. Except you, everything else is the seen.
  • Karana and karya vada are the words of the dualist. Very provisional theory. Before you become victim of this, you have to move to drg drshya viveka to be safe from duality and unfortunate mix-up of religion and philosophy.
  • The line of argument here is the discernment between you, the knowing element, and all that is known.
  • You’re not any of the things that you imagine about yourself. Provisionally we give you a title “jiva”. Because you do not allow the divinity to come out.
  • If you give drg drshya viveka a chance, it will force you into your divinity.
  • Purify the “I”. You’ve collected so much it that it becomes a big task. How you do it? No effort, just vichara. Knowing the false as the false, investigation, is the toughest thing. People go for the easy thing and avoid the real one.
  • Guru will not, cannot break the shell from outside. You’ve to do it from inside.
  • Those who want to see UFOs will see UFOs. Those who think of a god in a way will see god such way. Mind becomes the God. What you see, what you know cannot be the truth.
  • Karma, upasana is outward looking. Jnanam, yoga is inward looking. They cannot be combined.
  • Karma -> phala later. It is mediate. Realization has immediate benefit. Like with rope and snake. Now and here. Can there be understanding in the future? Understanding happens only in the present. Only death happens in the future.
  • In Sanskrit, “cha” and “ka” are interchangeable. Lochanam -> luk (taking “ana” way makes guna go away too and ‘o’ -> ‘u’, ‘ch’ and ‘k’ are interchangeable).
  • Prepare your consciousness in which you do not pay attention to the form. Form is unimportant, because it is not real. The more you pay attention to the form, the more you have emotional investment to the form, the more trouble you’re creating yourself. It is always the false that binds. Truth liberates.
  • Memory makes you think a lot. Keep it away when you don’t need it. We’re registering forms since we can remember. How many did we see? There is mental forms, like boundaries between countries, too. The form is known to you, don’t make it into “you”.

Class 2

  • What is is the truth.
  • sa:itara - en:other. The other means limited means measurable. Jnanam of … is invalid in the context of brahman, valid in any other case.
  • People are looking elsewhere for solution of problems of life, happiness. Towards the physical things made of hand, towards another person, towards god. All in vain. Because you must begin with yourself, in yourself. Antarmukhah. Viveka: stop searching outside what can be found only within.
  • Clarify the mind (of superstitions), purify the heart (do not entertain emotions like hatred, jealousy) and then sanctify your life.
  • Life is a series of experiences.
  • Yoga people are dualist, they include people in the aham experience. Bhatka people are dualist too, they include god in the idam experience. Vedantins also say god has to be included in the aham experience only, but go one step further and say aham-brahma-asmi.
  • idam is aneka. Aham is always eka.
  • Drshyam is jada, drg is chetana. Is what I’m worshiping jada? There is any numbers of inadequacies in drshya. Drshya is very fickle, it changes, anything can happen to it.
  • Literality is religion and spirituality is philosophy.
  • Bhaktas take sentimentality as atmajnanam.
  • All I see in this hall is limited. But my eyesight is not limited. It can see anything and everything.
  • Pascal: as a body I am but a speck in this universe, but with my mind I can assess everything in it. Mind is the seer, that is it’s glory. Now go one step further, mind becomes the seen.
  • You’re not supposed to give importance to the rupa. Learn to ignore the rupa. You love something that is beyond the rupa.
  • When a form disintegrates, I feel neutral. And when the person was suffering, I feel good about it. People are getting grief-stricken for no reason. Because they invest so much emotionalism in to that form.

Satsang 2022-09-03

  • It’s not that you’ve questions and I’ve answers. We examine things together.
  • Many questions show that you’re thining. Most important is that you’re thinking. Once you start thinking and paying attention you’ll find all answers in yourself.
  • Sanyasa is neither necessary nor sufficient condition for moksha. Sanyasa in spirit you’d have. What you have to give up is desire - people don’t like that. Desireless-ness leads to fearlessness. Desirelessness and fearlessness together constitute moksha. That’s the sanyasa you require.
  • For some people, who don’t fit into family life and equally not to worldly life, sanyasa is the avenue available.
  • People want to maintain diabetes or do you want to get rid of it? Same applies for desires. You don’t want to manage them.
  • Root cause of anxiety is desire, expectation and anticipation. Attachment breads fear, of which anxiety/worry is only a form of.
  • Only a doer can have a goal. If you have a goal to be reached, you become anxious. Surrender the self to Ishvara. If Ishvara wishes, we’ll reach whatever we have to reach. Allow the natural thing happen naturally. Be a guide upon yourself.
  • It is the thought that generates stress. Stress is related to anxiety.
  • Being a worldly person how can you get rid of anxiety? You cannot!
  • Cellphone makes you anxious. How many times you check your email is a measurement of your anxiety. Cellphone is the umbilical cord to the world.
  • Am I playing the role of the father or am I bound by the role?
  • You have to protect your heart, that is your wealth. Your heart is hiranmayakosha, the treasure full of light of awareness, in that Brahma is shining as atma. You’ve to protect it from worldliness. And that is accomplished by satsanga. You’d not talk much. Talking much makes the mind becomes hyperactive. It will acquire tremendous speed. Remain alone and disengage with the worldly things, people, context. Don’t attend any marriages, festivals, functions., celebrations.
  • In the temple you don’t come across bhaktas. You come across fathers, mothers, afraid people, desirers. Don’t enter the threshold of a temple with identification.
  • Whatever be the rupa you come across in a temple, say “OM”. All are OM, nothing else. The Ishvara is in my heart as the inner most self. So you attachment to form is replaced by the sound “OM”.
  • Who’s learning? There is no “who”! That’s what you’ve to learn. There is only ajnanam, no ajnani. There is only illness, there is no sick person. Does the physician threat the patient or the illness? He doesn’t recognize a patient, only an illness. Jiva is only provisional, sruti goes along for a while until you know that you’re brahman.
  • Vedanta is entirely about unlearning.

Class 3

  • Meditation
    • You do not have any issues in life if you’re in the present.
    • Guide yourself. Two deep breaths will bring you into present.
    • While breathing out, imagine you throw out (mercilessly and forcefully) the anxieties also.
    • Prana and mind are connected. One effects the other.
    • Be aware of the sounds but do not name it e.g. that is a motor, I know it… Don’t allow that train of thoughts. Without all that movement of the mind you can still be aware of the sound. You’ve reached the state of inner silence, as you’re aware.
    • That inner silence is the foundation of life. It’s not void, it’s full to the brim. You’re as a person are not there. That’s the samadhi of the vedantins.
  • Unless there is a contrast, you’ll not see anything.
  • When you see things, you start judging the things. Now you’ve started your samsara. Started at the very young age and it will be going on and on. Aindriyaka jivanam - focus on what the sight cognizes. “World is full of opposites and god it”. Why should he? No, it was you!
  • Eyesight is like a mirror, not like a camera. It reflects the forms and then forms are erased. You remain clean, free from forms. Where do you want to focus, on the outside of forms with opposites? These opposites bind people.
  • People are not selling beauty (roses, jewelry, building, art, landscape, tree…). They are selling ideas! The quality of the beauty is not out there. People who assume so are living a life of aindriyaka jivanam - in a dream. And all of it will collapse. Beauty is in you. When the mind is silent, the awareful being comes into the fore and there is a beauty in it.
  • No self-centered activity - activity without seeking anything for one self. It’s there in you. Only you have to make it more pronounced. You’re not egoistic all the time.
  • Mind, which has no self-centered activity in it, is the most beautiful thing.
  • Any time you assume there is joy in the outer it will cheat you, it will prove to you unequivocally that there is no joy in it. Joy is not an attribute of the outer.
  • Life a life of viveka, viveki jivan, not aindriyaka. Every time you pay the price for sukham with dukham. Stop seeking any sukham and you’ll not know what’s dukham.
  • Eyesight is not really drg, it is drshyam. It is not the subject. It can be good / bad. But who is the subject now? Mind.
  • Seeing means knowing the forms. Hearing mean knowing the sounds.
  • When you focus on the sounds you’re in dvaita. When you focus on the hearing you’ve come into the advaita.
  • When you’re aware of the sounds you’re listening. When you name the sound and judge it you’re hearing.
  • Music is not in the notes. It is in the silence between the notes. Notes are outside, you hear those notes and in between is the silence and in that silence is the music. R-a-m-a is what I hear. When it is complete there is a silence. And in that silence there is the knowledge of Rama. Silence is not void, it is fullness. It has everything. All knowledge, all joy, all beauty is in you. Satyam-shivam-sundaram.
  • Fragrance is not outside. Outside is a flower with aromatic volatile oil, which throws out molecules. A few of them enter into your nose and create the joy of fragrance in the receptors in your nose. Same for skin. Important only: nama & rupa. All sense work in the same way.
  • Sweetness is in the tongue, not in the object. Therefore do not pay attention to the multiple objects, pay attention to the tongue.
  • Why should you drink sweet drinks? It’s not worth drinking. Water is.

Class 4

  • The word “knowledge”, “knowing” is already reserved for ideation. When you say it it could be only an “idea”.
  • From from “namarupa” into the thing. That’s called study of Vedanta. Everything else is conceptual study. There is no value in it.
  • Spiritual dimension cannot be introduced in itself. It has to be introduced through the drsya. Provisionally present the psychological dimension as the drg (which it is in reference to the physical) and through it then take you into the higher dimension. That’s the job of the speaker, that can be done only with cooperation with the student.
  • Mind is the stepping stone into the spirit.
  • Mind is not one thing. It’s a bag.
  • Waking consciousness is the background of the mind’s movement.
  • The brain has two lobes. One is intellect, the other deals with emotions and is called mind.
  • If you look at your consciousness you can clearly notice how it is moving. In there there is kama (desires). It becomes a habit with people and they cannot live in comfort. Always uneasy or disturbed, because something or the other is missing. Where ever you put them, they complain.
  • Instead of teaching simplicity the religion teaches desires.
  • If you give a freedom to the mind it has a set of questions. And if answer is given you feel very happy. There is a joy in it.
  • Tamasi dhrtih is all about eating. Rajasi about ambition.
  • Accumulated knowledge will disintegrate, not understanding. Learning is accumulation.
  • When you psychologically depend on the other person, you’re insecure. What will happen when the other person doesn’t oblige? When you’re dependent on the money, you’ll become very insecure when you lose it.
  • I’m giving up this and I’m ready for whatever consequence. Then you’re ready for sanyasa. Retirement, 401k funds, insurance are all born from the sense of insecurity.
  • You’ve to examine whether you’ve that sense of insecurity in you. Am I afraid of death? Illness? Maybe yes. That means there is some identification. I have to work on it. Are you afraid when you’re alone? No. Good, you’re not psychologically dependent on somebody. That’s the book of your mind, that you’ve to read.
  • Real is in you. And the mind is there as a gatekeeper, that doesn’t allow you to embrace the reality. You’re that already. But you don’t feel it. You don’t feel that divinity, fullness. Ask yourself: Do I feel inadequate? That’s the fullness. Actually it’s more negative. You do not feel insecurity, you feel love for all. Even you love the door to the point that you don’t bang it. You just close it carefully. You love a paper, you don’t want to waste it. When you love this insentient objects, what to speak of people? Including those, who throw some dust on you. That’s divinity. YOU HAVE TO FEEL IT, IT IS NOT INTELLECTUAL. That doesn’t serve much purpose.
  • You can’t feel the brahmanhood only because the mind is making too much noise. Just like clouds are enough to cover the sun. Mind veils your swarupa.
  • Love is not sentimentality, love is not attachment. Dismiss all sentimentality, attachment, aversion and all those things and then you come to love. You feel love. Feel it to all. You feel the sense of love towards a friend and towards a foe equally. That love is brahman.
  • Mind is not chetana. It is physical, material. Mirror is the sand only that was heated to few thousand degrees. Body and mind are of the same material. Mind is very subtle. Yet it is physical thing. A machine. Mind also moves and produces thoughts. Mind is the machine of thought process.
  • Suppose you look at yourself notice a flow of thoughts. That’s the mind. Suppose you notice there is no thought. Who knows that there is no thought. Are you not aware of the thoughtless state of mind? The thoughtlessness, the gap between a thought and another is with you. When you sneeze, you don’t think. If you pay attention to something, the thought comes to an end. And then comes again. To whom is known the thought process. Watch your mind. Stand apart from it and understand it.
  • Develop the space of being aware of the thoughts/emotions. That means you’re already free from it. You’ve stepped back. Who’s that that’s free from it? The one who’s aware of it!

Satsang 2022-09-04

  • Our greed is the investment for the corporate world.
    • Just be totally devoted to the job. Forget about corporate people pushing their ways etc.
    • Stop finding scapegoats, always look within.
  • God bless him.
    • If he’s right, I learned something about me and I’ve got something to correct.
    • If he’s wrong, thank god he’s wrong.
  • Face all the challenges with courage. You’d never appeal to the outside, man or god, but to the god who’s in you. He’s listening to you and always watching you. He’s atma, sakshi he’s. Appeal to the inner sakshi and take blessing from him and move forward.
  • Seeing Niagara on the Internet is just nama rupa. You must see and lose yourself in the seeing. That seeing is brahman. The fact, the truth of seeing is brahman. The seer seen superimposition is samsara. Therefore you’ve to go to Niagara. Doesn’t matter how many times you’ve done it, it’s always new. It’s always for the first time. Meet anything and everything fresh! The number doesn’t matter, it’s memory, unreal.
    • Few drops of rain on my head I consider a great blessing. In that raindrop I see the origin of all the oceans of the world.
    • Life is always fresh, we only look at it through the prism of the memory and then it becomes stale.
  • I look at the jealousy. It’s very familiar for all of us. I’m aware of it, without condemnation. It’s natural consequence of comparison, of the way we’ve been brought up. It’s not a crime. And that I see that it hurts myself and goes against the vision of Vedanta. Jealousy has no meaning, I learn a lesson. This is not accumulative knowledge. From then on I’m not feeling jealous.
    • What you learn is not accumulation.
  • Seeking: substitute seeking with striving and everything will be all-right. Generally people are not earnest. They are just seekers. By habit.
  • Two kinds of impurities of the mind. Sakashaya dosha - jealousy, anger, etc. Nishkashaya dosha - hyperactivity of the mind, restlessness. You cannot sit for 5 minutes. Simple pranayama will help.
    • Give up multitasking. Be devoted to one task at the time.
    • Multitasking will not increase productivity. It compromises productivity.
  • Religion is belief, philosophy is rational thinking. See Bhakta & Bhakti talks.
    • easy vs. difficult
    • divides vs. unites.
    • binds you vs. sets you free, no shackles
    • you’re a doer vs. you’re a non-person
  • Idea that Pujaswami will take birth again is not correct. Atma is the same for all. The only difference is that a mahatma knows it.
  • Don’t worry about the youngsters. They are more dharmic than us. They are certain elements of dharma in us that they don’t have. They are more catholic than us. Future generations are already safe. Only we’re not safe yet. We have to pay attention to ourselves.
  • “Sun illuminates everything”. You cannot say that. There is no doing on the part of the sun. It just is. When the sun is, everything gets illuminated. “Sun illuminates” is also not correct. Illumination is not an action (sun doesn’t take a broomstick and removes the darkness). “Sun is the shining”. Sun is the light. Nothing more, no verb there. Same for brahman.
  • A wrong question cannot be answered, it can be only seen/understood as a wrong question.
  • If you’re waiting for something, it can be only death.
  • Vedantins love death, mrtyuh. Brahmavidyacarya - kathopanishad.

Guided meditation

  • Who am I? It’s a query without an answer. All answers which are but conclusions are merely conditioned responses. Just ignore them, they have no value. Only the query has value.

Class 5

  • Singularity. Time is the byproduct of creation.
  • A believing person is a not a thinking person.
  • People are like children. They want children. And they believe the stories wholeheartedly.
  • People live superficially. They believe. Asking questions makes you go into the depths of consciousness and investigate. Living on the surface makes us very agitated. That’s the movement of the mind. Like a cork on a water with a lot of disturbance.
  • When you look at the mind are you not already free from the limitations of mind?
  • I notice my limitation. Lo behold, I’m aware of my limitation. And you should not condemn it, if you do you’ve lost the game. So I’m free of that limitation.
  • The entire movement of the mind is an object. Don’t give the mistake of giving it the status of the subject.
  • I’m observing but without being an observer. Otherwise I’m an egotistic observer. Observing and judging, justifying, assessing, evaluating, condemning. Do you know how ego operates? It condemns what it observes. Example: somebody tells I’m an idiot. Will I become an idiot only because somebody says so? When you observe, you’ll not get hurt.
  • Alert is same as aware. Alert means ego is not there.
  • Observation without condemnation. Means without ID. That is the definition of awareness. Awareness brings understanding. Justification, ID, condemnation … there is no understanding. If you have understanding, there is no frustration.
  • When Rama met Ravana for the first time he gave him a piece of advice. “Nothing is lost, release Sita, go home and live a long life”. There is no enmity.
  • There is no end in view. No “let me be aware to get moksha in three months”. Just trust the process. You’re focused on the process, not on the end.
  • Awareness is not self-improvement. The egoistic self is the false self. Don’t bring drg drsya viveka to the level of psychology. In psychology the mind is real. Here only atma is real. On the contrary it is the end of the small “me” which is there in the braincells. You don’t find this “me” in no other part of the body but braincells. Don’t be head people (kundalini goes to the head). Be heart people.
  • Ego holds memory. That’s why when the braincells become weak, memory is lost.
  • Krishna: “As long as you’re pursuing moksha you’ll not get it”
  • As long as you take yourself as a person, guru be a person. And god will be another person. You’re not a person, but tattvam. So is guru, so is Ishvara.
  • What is world? It is not relative to your senses and mind? It is mithya. Minus senses and mind where is the world? How can you call jagat real.
  • Sakshi: that which sees without any means for seeing. You see the mind, you see yourself without any means. Sun illuminates everything else. And shines by itself. You know the world by light and the sun is light. We don’t want to say “illuminates itself”. There is no action.
  • In the awareness there is no becoming. There is only mere silent observation.

item.title: Upadesha Sahasri - Chapter 19
item.description:
Class 1

  • Upadesha is instruction. In jnanam there is only instruction, no handing over. Like there is in religion - handing over a mantra. The one instructing you can call instructor.
  • You need not instruct nobody to go to a physician when he’s ill. But when the psyche is ill, nobody will even acknowledge that he’s sick. And when somebody points out that you’re sick in the mind, you become angry. Diagnosis: worldliness -> frustration, agitation. The fact that the people become angry shows that they’re ill.
  • Psychological dimension dominates. If there is a disorder in this area, your physiological dimension never can become safe and secure.
  • Don’t overdo anything. It is a curse. Even for shravanam. When you do, manana and niddidhiasanam are given a go-by.
  • You have to lecture yourself. You have to instruct yourself. Look at yourself, look at the mind, and you give a lecture to the mind. That is the self-instruction. Watch the movement of your mind, be aware of its entire movement. Without your effort a silence will enter into you. It is the gateway into the real.
  • Jnanam - recognising the false as false. You cannot recognise the self. If you recognise it, it becomes the other.
  • Health - just cessation of roga. Becoming normal. No special benefit.
  • When there is a disorder in the subtle, the gross becomes the victim. Medicine for the subtle is dispassion (viraga, vayragyam).
  • How to get the dispassion? First viveka, then vayragyam.
  • Inquire. Woman might not inquire. Man should inquire. Why should men inquire. Even woman should have some gold, but not the passion. Passion is wrong. It is developed out of wrong thinking.
  • The fever is the trshnah, greed. Intense attachment to sense pleasures. Wealth and pleasure. All the commercials, advertisements are meant to attract people towards them. To create a sensation in the mind of a person, to occupy the mental space of the people and inject this passion, greed, attachment to pleasures into the mind. The defect by which the immunity is compromised is that the mind wants always more. Vulnerability of seeking more. Regarding any sense pleasure: food, money, watching TV etc.
  • Close your eyes and notice whether the sense of more is coming again and again. Finally tell yourself you do not need more. In fact, you do not need anything. It is the body that needs some food.
  • To realize your true self you need to have a healthy mind in a healthy body. Body has cancer. Mind has trshna. You satisfy it and comes again back and wants more.

Class 2

  • The fever of the mind - attachment to the sense pleasures. Intense desires. Medicine - jnana viraga bhesayam.
  • Body is the instrument of action and therefore needs to be put to action. Medicine for it will be physical. Mind is the instrument of cognition. Any irregularity, illness in the mind will be cognitive in nature. Medicine will be cognitive - understanding of what is the self and what is non-self.
  • viraga follows naturally from viveka. The combination of these two is the medicine.
  • “What’s in it for me?” is a fundamentally flawed attitude. You’re not supposed to work for a reward. But for the love of the work. Reward is anatma and therefore unreal. Your dispassion is in question again.
  • Practice viveka and vairagya just like you breath-in and breath-out. You’re not thinking of any reward. This is the very spontaneity and this is also effortless.
  • trsnah is the abnormal. It is the single source of illness. It will manifest in the body.
  • Elimination of illness is the benefit. You remain what you are, normal. There is no positive benefit for any medicine.
  • Identification with the desired object is the infection, the origin of the mental fever.
  • In Sanskrit “becoming” and “taking a birth” are considered the same.
  • Today’s morning person is born out of the yesterday’s desiring person.
  • Give up the desire for sukhah and you will not know what is dukhah.
  • You’re the atma, you’re aware of the movement of the mind. You’ll address, lecture the mind. You’re the guru to you. In identification you’re the mind. In disidentification you’re the atma. Buddha: be a light upon yourself.

Class 3 - center, prisoner of space and time

  • Opposite of being aware of your own consciousness (which is not in motion) is not alert. You’re identified with the mind. You’re one with the flow, you do not have any space with reference to this flow. You’re a samsari.
  • Be a witness to the mind. You’re looking at the mind. Mind is the other. In doing so you’ve discovered the mental space in reference to the mind. Now the mental states do not define you. You’re aware of them. There is sukha, there is duhka. But you don’t become sukhi, you don’t become dukhi.
  • Most of the people are followers. Not thinkers.
  • The calamity the mind has created for us is aham and mama.
  • Look at yourself. There is a center in you. What is it? A bunch of memories. That is the “me”. It is the result of time. A center has always a space around it. And the space is bounded. As long as there is a center, there is circumference and the bounded space occupied by limited things. You created this prison.
  • Some people say I’m free. I’ve free will. There is no free will separate from the supreme will. It is like the prisoner saying I’m free between the prison walls.
  • All the concepts outside of his space become extraordinarily important for the prisoner. In spite of acquiring all the concepts (religion, culture, family, etc.) he’s still in prison. As long as there is the center there is no freedom. There center always creates space. No matter how big it will be it will be still limited. Prisoner of space and time.
  • Do your job. Do everything with tremendous vitality. But you don’t need a center for it.
  • The moment you’re asking for a method you’re creating time.
  • Me is the jiva. It creates duality. There is a bigger me called God. Dvaitam is the product of me.
  • Look at the rising sun with the eyes of the gayatri manta. You’ll not experience any division between yourself and the sun. Like looking at the beloved person. There is no me in you. Me vanishes. You the pure being, are just looking at another expression of your self. Without center-me you’ll experience a vast space.
  • Me is the complex thing. The real simplicity is looking at things without me.
  • It is possible to live in the world without “me” and “mine”.
  • Sankhyas: posit the individual separate from the mind movement. There is a person called jiva and they called it atma. Atma is many. And then there is the mind moving and the mind is moving for the benefit of atma. First create me out of the movement of the mind and then say the movement of mind is meant for the benefit of this me. Mind is moving and creating sukha/dukha benefit for the jiva. All movement of the mind is meant for the multiple jivas called atma too.

Class 4 - mind as machine

  • The only calamity in life is “me” and “mine” syndrome. The first three purushartas are centered around me and mine and they strengthen the syndrome.
  • Sankhya example (wrong): chariot (mind) moves for the benefit of the master (atma). If mind moves the right way, atma gets joy, otherwise suffering. Atma is connected to pleasure and pain, atma becomes the bokta and mind is the karta.
  • Oh silly mind how can you create situations of enjoyment to me, the atma? You don’t have sentience, you’re jada. You cannot do nothing by itself. Also, atma doesn’t need any enjoyment generated by the mind.
  • Mind is a machine. Mere machine. It has a process, it functions and produces something. The thought process.
  • Mind receives the sensations, converts the sensations into experience, then gives a label to the experience and records the experience. Next time the thought comes out of this memory.
  • What is outside is always fresh and new. But the sensation goes into the mind, the mind compares and contrasts and makes it into a repetition. Even when you look at your spouse in the morning, you’re looking at her freshly. But the mind makes it a repetition. It converts the present into past. Mind can only be repetitive. It can never have something original. Original comes from something more deep down.
  • What is before you is fresh, the sensation is fresh. But mind makes it repetitive. The thought can never be fresh. Thought is always a response of the memory. Therefore thought can never be creative.
  • When you can never produce anything original (mind), better keep quiet (atma).
  • Controlled mind (hathayoga) is not a free mind.
  • When the mind becomes silent, it becomes knowledgable about its own movement. Quiet mind means freedom from thinking. Why are you sorrowful or excited? Because you’re thinking. Why are you conflicted? Because the thought produces the conflict.
  • Freedom from thinking is moksha.
  • If your mind is moving slowly, you don’t have many thoughts.
  • In jumping from one thought to the other you’ve become a victim of memory.
  • Mind is creating thoughts. Thought is from the memory, from the past.
  • When memory is put aside you’re experiencing freshness. That brings out the creative being in you.
  • Knowledge - pious name given to the memory.
  • When you know your mind, the limits of your mind, you’re beyond the mind.
  • We don’t come across human beings, but across human doings (doctor, teacher, engineer, ..).
  • Does your mediation spring from time or is timeless? Your meditation is also a doing. The real meditation is the essence of life. Is being aware of the mind. There is no phalam for it. It is a merger with the timelessness.

Class 5

  • “Be a light unto yourself” - Buddha’s last advice to his disciples.
  • Generally when people are alone they remain occupied. They indulge in a variety of thoughts. Instead try to watch your mind. Very soon, you’ll be bored. That means you’re not comfortable with looking at your mind. Therefore address the mind: “mind, I’m always contented. I don’t care whether you’re or not.”
  • As long as you’re with the thoughts of the mind. You remain discontented. Fullness you never get by identifying with the mind.
  • People are not contented at all. Moving from one to another. From one relationship to another. From one religion to another. For what? They’re all dogmatic. They think, that through such movement of change they will find happiness. Meaning they are unhappy to start with.
  • Change for the sake of change or because you’re bored/disenchanted with one thing, or because you’re unhappy to start with, will never make you happy.
  • Contentment is true when you remain without any desire to change. If the change happens naturally I’m not resisting.
  • The trouble begins with comparing what you have with somebody else and therefore you want to change. You’d live a life without comparison. First compare, next condemn and then become unhappy.
  • I learn to live with my lot. I do not compare, I do not condemn. I desire no change. Any change that happens naturally is OK.
  • When you’re not comparing you’re looking at the things as they are.
  • Advise the mind to remain healthy by becoming quiet. Desires make the mind dull.
  • Religious-minded persons should be extra careful. Entire religion seems to have one purpose - get you what you seek.
  • We’re speaking of contentment, not speaking of indulgence, laziness. Contentment is timelessness. Desire for change is always time. We’re not waiting for future.
  • Hope is no better than desire as far as creating psychological time is concerned.
  • When a thought or feeling arises, just watch it. Be aware of it. Out of it comes silence. That’s meditation! You’re not asking, not striving for silence. It naturally happens.

Class 6

  • This center, “me”, ego is as much a thought as any other silly thought. Any other thought might not have much significance. Pot-thoughts comes and goes. Whereas the me-thought stays there. Whole life it will be there unless you know yourself correctly, unless you realize that this “me” is false. And it will pick up a new body and continue to be there also. Therefore people identify with that “me”. This is the story of the ahamkara and the role of the ahamkara is the bondage of the samsara.
  • If you allow the ego to go, it will go. If you know it as false, it will vanish.

  • The “me” and “mine” don’t help you to live in a family, in a society, in a city and practicing a honest profession. They are only a big burden.
  • If you learn concepts you’re not learning anything. That’s why we discuss issues here.
  • Look at your mind. And you’ll be abiding as your true self. (Disidentification). You’re never away from it. In every cognition (thought) the light of atma is shining brilliantly.
  • A concept is never the truth. Push them aside and in their place create an issue. Cultivate a little impatience to know the truth and settle the issue of atma.
  • God creates chronological time, you create psychological time by pursuing your objects.

  • Don’t drink/eat for enjoyment.
  • Not seeking the pleasure is not a stale state, it is the precondition for self-realization. Every pain is the price for the pleasure you’ve sought and enjoyed.

Class 7

  • Sorrow and fear do not exist independent of the thought.
  • Sruti talks of unity. Smrti has divisive thinking as its essence. All divisive thinking comes from it. In smrti all the things are real and different from everything else.
  • Window is not the source of light.

  • Smrti converts the sruti into a dead letter.
  • You perceive a tree because you have the word “tree” in your mind and that word is associated with a form. Mind is memory, bundle of past-experiences converted into knowledge.   • Your consciousness is all-knowing. When you know English, you know it. When you don’t know French, you know it too. Never underestimate its (your own) glory as the very ground of cognitions. The consciousness is always flowing through the prison of nama rupa put in place by the mind.
  • Acknowledge you’re the boss and not the mind. You command the mind “keep quit, I’m not interested in your movement in the form of supplying nama rupa in every cognition”. You’re coloring every cognition with nama rupa. When you try this this is shiva-drsthi. Shambavi mudra.
  • The mind always wants to categorize. If it can’t, it will be very uneasy. Let not the mind categorize and there still will be perception. Without categorization the perception cannot disturb you. And somehow strangely you’ll see that the perception is no other than you.

Class 8

  • Pay attention to the inhalation and exhalation and understand that they are not connected to the finite (body, mind) but to the life giving air, the universal, the infinite.

Class 9

  • Really speaking it is the mind that get’s caught and get’s liberated. Atma is never bound.

  • In giving a situation the name “pleasant” I’ve already created the “painful” situation. You’ll be always caught in the conflict of opposites. Just see facts, don’t give names.
